thread.title: Entrepreneurs roll out tech tools aimed at Boomers, seniors

author: Marissa Lang
title: Entrepreneurs roll out tech tools aimed at Boomers, seniors
text:
Photo: Carlos Avila Gonzalez, The Chronicle print_article_embed|photo-8606671|article-6496932|7 comments_jump_embed|photo-8606671|article-6496932|1 email_share_embed|photo-8606671|article-6496932|1 facebook_share_embed|photo-8606671|article-6496932|2 twitter_share_embed|photo-8606671|article-6496932|3 pinterest_share_embed|photo-8606671|article-6496932|4 reddit_share_embed|photo-8606671|article-6496932|5 google_share_embed|photo-8606671|article-6496932|6 Jean Anne Booth CEO of UnaliWear, right, chats with Helynna Brooke, left, and Laurence Berger, center, at an Aging 2.0 event in San Francisco, Calif., where entrepreneurs pitched elder care innovation ideas at UCSF on Wednesday, September 9, 2015. Jean Anne Booth CEO of UnaliWear, right, chats with Helynna Brooke,...
The challenge was simple: Bring technology to one of the populations that engage with it least — people over 50. Jean Anne Booth CEO of UnaliWear, right, chats with Helynna Brooke, left, and Laurence Berger, center, at an Aging 2.0 event in San Francisco, Calif., where entrepreneurs pitched elder care innovation ideas at UCSF on Wednesday, September 9, 2015. Jean Anne Booth CEO of UnaliWear, right, chats with Helynna Brooke,...
The challenge was simple: Bring technology to one of the populations that engage with it least — people over 50.
